info.name: Ed-Fi ODS/API Composite Profile Test Suite

request.description:
This api post method adds new academicWeeks for particular school .
This test method will throw WeekIdentifier is required error when WeekIdentifier is not passed

request.description:
# Flattened Reference -> Collection
Scenario: Composites include flattened references with collection
    When building a composite resource for the "SchoolFlattenedReferenceWithCollection" composite 
    Then the composite resource should have Collection "SchoolCategories" with only properties [SchoolCategoryDescriptor]
    And the composite resource should have Collection "SchoolGradeLevels" with only properties [GradeLevelDescriptor]

item.description:
Scenario: Composite resource contains School which is constrained by an include-only Profile
    Given the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-Resource-IncludeOnly" profile
    And the subject of the request is a school with a LocalEducationAgency
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "School" composite
    Then the response model should have only the specific members [id, schoolId, nameOfInstitution, operationalStatusDescriptor, type, administrativeFundingControlDescriptor, addresses, schoolCategories]

item.description:
Scenario: Composite resource contains Staff which is constrained by an include-all Profile
    Given the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-StaffOnly-Resource-IncludeAll" profile
    And the subject of the request is a staff
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "Staff" composite
    Then the response model should have only the specific members [id, staffUniqueId, personalTitlePrefix, firstName, lastSurname, sexDescriptor, birthDate, hispanicLatinoEthnicity, loginId, addresses, electronicMails, identificationCodes, languages, races, telephones, classifications]
    And the response model at path "classifications[0]" should only have the specific members [classification]

exec: pm.test("Should the item return with message There is no Readable content type available to the caller for the 'edfi.School' resource in the following profiles: 'Test-Profile-Resource-WriteOnly'", () => {
pm.expect(responseItem.message).to.equal("There is no Readable content type available to the caller for the 'edfi.School' resource in the following profiles: 'Test-Profile-Resource-WriteOnly'.");

request.description:
# Flattened Reference -> Collection
Scenario: Composites include flattened references with collection
    When building a composite resource for the "SchoolFlattenedReferenceWithCollection" composite 
    Then the composite resource should have Collection "SchoolCategories" with only properties [SchoolCategoryDescriptor]

item.description:
Scenario: Composite resource's base resource is constrained by a write-only Profile
    Given the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-Resource-WriteOnly" profile
    And the subject of the request is a school with a LocalEducationAgency
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "School" composite
    Then the response should contain a 405 Method Not Allowed failure indicating that "There is no Readable content type available to the caller for the requested resource."

exec: pm.test("Should the item return with all addresses should have addressTypeDescriptor values of either Physical or Home", () => {

request.description:
# Flattened Reference -> Collection
Scenario: Composites include flattened references with collection
    When building a composite resource for the "SchoolFlattenedReferenceWithCollection" composite

item.description:
Scenario: Composite resource is constrained by a Profile with an inclusive collection value filter on a child collection
    Given the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-For-Composites-With-Multiple-Resources" profile
    And the subject of the request is a Section with associated Staff and Students with address type code values of [Physical, Home, Mailing]
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "SectionEnrollment" composite
    Then the response model at path "students[*]/educationOrganizations[*]/addresses[*]" should have "addressTypeDescriptor" values of [uri://ed-fi.org/AddressTypeDescriptor#Physical, uri://ed-fi.org/AddressTypeDescriptor#Home]

exec: pm.test("Should the item return students[0]/educationOrganizations[0]/addresses[0] should only have the specific members [addressTypeDescriptor, city, postalCode, stateAbbreviationDescriptor, streetNumberName]", () => {

pm.test("Should the item return with  specific members [id, sectionIdentifier, sequenceOfCourse, educationalEnvironmentDescriptor, availableCredits, staff, students, academicSubjectDescriptor, sessionReference, classPeriods, courseOfferingReference, locationReference, locationSchoolReference]", () => {
pm.test("Should the item return staff[0] should not have the specific members [sexType, birthDate, hispanicLatinoEthnicity]", () => {

pm.test("Should the item return students[0] should only have the specific members [id, studentSectionAssociation_id, studentUniqueId, firstName, lastSurname, educationOrganizations, schools]", () => {

request.description:
# Flattened Reference -> Collection
Scenario: Composites include flattened references with collection
    When building a composite resource for the "SchoolFlattenedReferenceWithCollection" composite 
    Then the composite resource should have Collection "SchoolCategories" with only properties [SchoolCategoryDescriptor]
    And the composite resource should have Collection "SchoolGradeLevels" with only properties [GradeLevelDescriptor]

item.description:
Scenario: Composite resource contains child elements composing Staff and Student which are constrained by two different profiles
    Given the caller is assigned the "Student-Readable-Restricted" profile
    And the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-For-Composites-With-Multiple-Resources" profile
    And the subject of the request is a Section with associated Staff and Students with address type code values of [Physical, Home]
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "SectionEnrollment" composite
    Then the response model should have only the specific members [id, sectionIdentifier, sequenceOfCourse, educationalEnvironmentDescriptor, availableCredits, staff, students, academicSubjectDescriptor, sessionReference, classPeriods, courseOfferingReference, locationReference, locationSchoolReference]
    # SexType is included by one profile, excluded by another, but should be included in the composite
    And the response model at path "staff[0]" should not have the specific members [sexType, birthDate, hispanicLatinoEthnicity]
    # Student's included properties are a combination of two "Include Only" profiles + LinkedCollections from the composite definition, which Profiles don't constrain
    And the response model at path "students[0]" should only have the specific members [id, studentSectionAssociation_id, studentUniqueId, firstName, lastSurname, educationOrganizations, schools]
    And the response model at path "students[0]/educationOrganizations[0]/addresses[0]" should only have the specific members [addressTypeDescriptor, city, postalCode, stateAbbreviationDescriptor, streetNumberName]

Scenario: Composite resource contains child collection which have value filters applied by two different profiles
    Given the caller is assigned the "Test-Profile-For-Composites-With-Multiple-Resources" profile
    And the caller is assigned the "Test-StudentEducationOrganizationAssociation-Exclude-All-Addrs-Except-Physical" profile
    And the subject of the request is a Section with associated Staff and Students with address type code values of [Physical, Home, Mailing]
    When a GET (by id) request is submitted to the test "SectionEnrollment" composite

exec: // Remove all environment variables that start with "known:" or "supplied:"
// Remove all environment variables related to Access Tokens
// Assumes Environment with Environment Variables: ApiBaseUrl, ApiKey, ApiSecret

// See https://gist.github.com/blmeyers/21138bbe6f80b8c35701a8754bfe59d5 for an environment sample for Local (NOTE: environment variable names have been changed from the gist -- you must adjust accordingly)
// Handles auto refreshing based on provided expiration, but doesn't handle the token being revoked early
// If stuck with "Bad Token" or "Not Authenticated", just delete the Token or TokenExpiry variables to force a new token
console.log('Token or expiry date are missing, retrieving new token')
console.log('Token is expired, retrieving new token')
// Ensure shared environment variables are available with each request
